input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a children "item" (to support multiple item support, we give "item" multiple times), which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Create Company
This wrapper creates company record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-company</operation-name> <model> <keys> </keys> <instance> <customer-since> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </customer-since> <customer-i-d> <value>CustomerID10</value> <type>String</type> </customer-i-d> <company-code> <value>Company Code</value> <type>String</type> </company-code> <address-line1> <value>Address</value> <type>String</type> </address-line1> <city> <value>City</value> <type>String</type> </city> <state> <value>State</value> <type>String</type> </state> <country> <value>Country</value> <type>String</type> </country> <zip-code> <value>Post</value> <type>String</type> </zip-code> <phone-number> <value>Phone Number</value> <type>String</type> </phone-number> <fax-number> <value>Fax Number</value> <type>String</type> </fax-number> <service-manager> <value>Servcei Manager</value> <type>String</type> </service-manager> <service-delivery-manager> <value>Service Delivery Manager</value> <type>String</type> </service-delivery-manager> <company-name> <value>Company Name</value> <type>String</type> </company-name> <default-s-l-a> <value>155</value> <type>Int</type> </default-s-l-a> </instance> </model> </item> </items> Elements’ Description:
The elements provided in the instance element refer to particular field of the record. We create an instance of this record by providing information in the <value> elements.
NOTE: The elements provided in <keys> element doesn’t mean that we are asking the application that these elements (the elements in the <keys> element) should be treated as keys for the record being created. Application has pre-defined key elements. The elements given in the <keys> element are meaning-less.
Complete Elements’ Description:
NOTE: To create a company record, you require at least <customer-i-d> and <company-code> to be populated properly. See the bold elements in this “Elements’ Description”.
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>create-company</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Customer-since[Optional] : The date-time since what the customer exists.
Valid Value: any input in ‘DateTime’ format. This format is- YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example,
2008.11.01 08:00:00
Name Of this element in the application: “Customer Since.”
Default Value: “”
customer-i-d [Required]: Customer Id, used as key too.
Valid Value: Any String.
Name Of this element in the application: “Customer ID.”
Default Value: No sense of default value. If you don’t provide anything to this element then record won’t be created.
Company-code [Required]: Code of company.
Valid Values : Any String.
Name Of this element in the application: “Company code.”
Default Value: No sense of default value. If you don’t provide anything to this element then record won’t be created.
Address-line [Optional] : Address.
Valid Values : Any string. Name Of this element in the application: “Address.”
Default Value: “”
City [Optional] : City of the company.
Valid Values : Any string. Name Of this element in the application: first field of “City/State/Post Code.”
Default Value: “”
State [Optional] : State name.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “City/State/Post Code.”
Default Value: “”
Country [Optional] : Country.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Country.”
Default Value: “”
Zip-code [Optional] : zip code.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Third field of “City/State/Post Code.”
Default Value: “”
Phone-number [Optional] : phone number.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Phone Number.”
Default Value: “”
Fax-number [Optional] : Fax Number.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Fax Number.”
Default Value: “”
Service-manager [Optional] : Service manager.
Valid Values: Any String. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Service Manager.”
Default Value: “”
Service-delivery-manager [Optional] : Service delivery manager.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Service Delivery Manager.”
Default Value: “”
Company-name [Optional] : Company name.
Valid Values: Any string. Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Company Name.”
Default Value: “”
Default-s-l-a [Optional] : Default SLA.
Name Of this element in the application: Second field of “Default SLA for Company.”
Valid Values: : Any integer values. These integer values are mapped to string values in application. The list of these mappings is customizable, i.e., more entries can be added to/deleted from it.
In out-of-box setup following mappings are available:
155 -> ACME Bronze 156 -> ACME Gold 157 -> ACME Platinum 158 -> ACME Silver 159 -> DEFAULT Bronze 160 -> DEFAULT Gold 161 -> DEFAULT Platinum 162 -> DEFAULT Silver 104 -> GEN Bronze 102 -> GEN Gold 101 -> GEN Platinum 103 -> GEN Silver 154 -> PRGN Bronze 152 -> PRGN Gold 151 -> PRGN Platinum 153 -> PRGN Silver
Here, if '155' is provided as value in item xml, on the application the value of this field will be 'ACME Bronze'
Default Value: “”

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Create Company
This wrapper creates company record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
